intro: Dichiloboea albida, commonly known as the white-flowered dichiloboea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
